com.bumptech.glide
Class Glide

java.lang.Object
  com.bumptech.glide.Glide

public class Glide
extends java.lang.Object

A singleton to present a simple static interface for Glide Glide.Request and to create and manage an ImageLoader and ModelLoaderFactorys. This class provides most of the functionality of ImagePresenter with a simpler but less efficient interface. For more complicated cases it may be worth considering using ImagePresenter and ImagePresenter.Builder directly.

Note - This class is not thread safe.

isImageManagerSet

public boolean isImageManagerSet()
Use to check whether or not an ImageManager has been set yet. Can be used in Activity.onCreate along with setImageManager to set an ImageManager with custom options for use with Glide.Request and/or as an easily accessible singleton.

Returns:
true iff an ImageManager is currently set

register

public <T> void register(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                         ModelLoaderFactory<T> factory)
Use the given factory to build a ModelLoader for models of the given class. Generally the best use of this method is to replace one of the default factories or add an implementation for other similar low level models. Typically the using(com.bumptech.glide.loader.model.ModelLoader) syntax is preferred because it directly links the model with the ModelLoader being used to load it.

Note - If a factory already exists for the given class, it will be replaced. If that factory is not being used for any other model class, ModelLoaderFactory.teardown() will be called.

Note - The factory must not be an anonymous inner class of an Activity or another object that cannot be retained statically.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the model
Parameters:
clazz - The class
factory - The factory to use

buildModelLoader

public static <T> ModelLoader<T> buildModelLoader(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                  android.content.Context context)
Build a ModelLoader for the given model class using a registered factory.

Type Parameters:

Parameters:
clazz - The class to get a ModelLoader for
context - Any context
Returns:
A new ModelLoader for the given model class
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no factory exists for the given class

using

public static <T> Glide.ModelRequest<T> using(ModelLoaderFactory<T> factory)
Set the ModelLoaderFactory and therefore the model type to use for a new load.

Note - You can use this method to set a ModelLoaderFactory for models that don't have a default ModelLoader/ModelLoaderFactory. You can also optionally use this method to override the default ModelLoader for a model for which there is a default. If you would like to permanently use this factory for all model loads of the this factory's type, see register(Class, com.bumptech.glide.loader.model.ModelLoaderFactory).

Note - If you have the ability to fetch different sized images for a given model, it is most efficient to supply a custom ModelLoaderFactory here to do so, even if a default exists. Fetching a smaller image means less bandwidth, battery, and memory usage as well as faster image loads. To simply build a url to download an image using the width and the height of the target, consider passing in a factory for a subclass of UrlModelLoader

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the model to load using this factory
Parameters:
factory - The ModelLoaderFactory to use to load an image from a given model
Returns:
A Glide.ModelRequest to set the specific model to load

load

public static Glide.Request<java.lang.String> load(java.lang.String string)
Use the ModelLoaderFactory currently registered for String to load the image represented by the given String. Defaults to StringLoader.Factory and StringLoader to load the given model.

Parameters:
string - The string representing the image. Must be either a path, or a uri handled by UriLoader
Returns:
A Glide.ModelRequest to set options for the load and ultimately the target to load the model into
See Also:

cancel

public static boolean cancel(android.widget.ImageView imageView)
See Also:
cancel(com.bumptech.glide.presenter.target.Target)

cancel

public static boolean cancel(Target target)
Cancel any pending loads Glide may have for the target. After the load is cancelled Glide will not load a placeholder or bitmap into the target so it is safe to do so yourself until you start another load.

Parameters:
target - The Target to cancel loads for
Returns:
True iff Glide had ever been asked to load an image for this target
